New Records: LeBron James secured his 114th career triple-double.
Key Match Events: LeBron James had 21 points, 13 assists, and 12 rebounds in his second triple-double of the season.
D'Angelo Russell added 18 points as a reserve.
Rookie Jared McCain had 18 points for Philadelphia.
Philadelphia erased an early 13-point deficit shortly before halftime, but the Lakers made an 8-0 run into the break and a 10-0 surge shortly after it to take charge.
Pre-Game Insights: Former league MVP Joel Embiid served the second game of his three-game suspension for shoving a reporter.
All-Star guard Tyrese Maxey missed his first game with the hamstring injury that will sideline him for at least two weeks.
Post-Match Reflections: Lakers coach JJ Redick's strategy appeared to work as the mercurial Russell played comfortably and aggressively as a reserve.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The 39-year-old James has seven triple-doubles since he passed Tim Duncan one year ago to become the second-oldest player in NBA history to accomplish the feat. Karl Malone was 40 years and 127 days old when he became the oldest player with a triple-double in November 2003.
